Instruction: In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add bananas and sugar, stirring until the sugar is dissolved. Pour in rum and cook for an additional 1 to 2 minutes. Place half of the banana mixture onto each flour tortilla, rolling them up and tucking in the ends like a burrito.
In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Fry chimichangas until they are golden brown. Drain on paper towels and serve warm.

We have calculated the nutritional value of the frying oil based on a retention rate of 10% after cooking. The actual amount may differ depending on cooking duration and temperature, ingredient density, and the particular type of oil utilized.
